results.title: Cambodia : the prince & the prophecy
results.brief_description: To understand Cambodia, the film delves to the roots of its culture and its conflicts. It looks back to the time of the great Kings of Angkor, how they ruled and how they survived as their empire crumbled; Cambodia’s fears and response to the thrust of their Vietnamese neighbours; the impact of colonisation by France and the struggle for independence in Indochina after the Second World War. The film explores the years of Prince Norodom Sihanouk’s rule, his juggle for peace, his charisma and contradictions. Following the Prince’s overthrow in 1970, the film traces Cambodia’s destruction during the five years of war before Pol Pot’s Khmer Rouge came to power and launched their revolution.

results.title: Calligraphy: craft of beautiful writing (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Briefly examines the history of written communication and the alphabet. A professional calligrapher demonstrates basic techniques and describes the necessary tools.

results.title: Caller herrin'
results.brief_description: A study of herring fishing in Scotland, showing the actual fishing activities of the drifters and their crews, the sampling of the catch when the fishing fleets return to port, the system of pricing the catch which ensures fair distribution, the preparation of the fish for the home market, for canning, and the kipper industry.

results.title: Call of the mountains
results.creator_credit: Arun Chaudhuri, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Student mountain climbers in the Himalayas. From all over India men come to the Government Mountaineering Institute based at Darjeeling. In classes they learn about weather behaviour, glaciers and map reading. Part of the course is a nine day trek to the foothills and throughout the journey the instructors, one of whom is Tenzing Norgay, give practical lessons using various equipment, crampons, pitons, ropes and erecting tents. Finally students and instructors climb one of the ice covered peaks. Contains some very beautiful landscape footage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arun Chaudhuri, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Call it courage
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A South Seas youth attempts to overcome his fear of the sea by sailing beyond the security of his island’s barrier reef. For young Mafatu, this simple trip becomes both a journey into peril, and a journey into manhood. Based on the novel of same title by Armstrong Sperry.

results.title: Call her sausage
results.creator_credit: Gus Meins, Hal Roach, Hal Roach Studios and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Ben proves to be the undoing when Billy opens a new deli. Ben and Billy do a variation of the famous “who’s on first” skit. A Taxi Boys’ comedy starring Billy Gilbert, Ben Blue, Lucile Browne, Billy Bletcher.

results.title: Call an ambulance
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A social studies film outlining the work of Civil Ambulance organisations in an Australian capital city. At all times the specially trained ambulance officers must be ready to answer accident and hospital calls in any part of the city. Ambulance men are seen working in co-operation with a Boy Scout group, in the discovery and rescue of an injured man in an isolated country area.

results.title: Calgary cowboy stampede
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: On the screen in close-up, and often in slow motion - the furious action of the world famous Calgary stampede - a spectacle to pin every viewer to their seat. Sun-fishing broncos, dare-devil cowboys, thundering chuckwagons - they are all here in this film of the annual extravaganza of the west. From the series: The Sport Parade.

results.title: Calder Hall: how a thermal reactor works
results.creator_credit: Ace Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Report to Geneva on the progress of Britain’s first nuclear power station, Calder Hall (close to Windscale Atomic Factory, Cumberland), July 1955. Describes the construction of the piles and the reactor. The film covers the various stages from the beginning of work on the preparation of the site in April 1953 to the summer of 1955 when the power station was three-quarters completed.

results.title: Calder Hall
results.brief_description: A report on Calder Hall, Britain’s first atomic power-station, as it was in July 1955. An engineer explains the layout of the two piles and the turbine house which will eventually produce electricity for a wide area.
